text:
Hello all -
I wrote about this a little while back with no solution, and customer support directed me here.

From the video below, on the manage preference page when the Unsubscribe box is checked all the preferences are unchecked, this is performing correctly, BUT when the opposite action happens, the Manage Preferences are checked the Unsubscribe box does not uncheck. Is there code that I could add to make it function properly? <https://www.loom.com/share/40e6bdf253794d0b9ee60fc1ac5b9dbf?sid=67f6eaff-deb8-4013-ab8f-d2e9ba05da72>

Is there a functional reason for wanting to do this? I haven't tested it, but I would suspect that despite the boxes staying checked, that the contact will still be set to Unsubscribe for all of the subscriptions in HubSpot.
Ohhh, I see. I read your message backwards. After seeing the video I see it's the reverse. That's odd.
This page can be sustomized to behave the way you want it to and even changes the css styles to match your brand

Where would you go to do that?

I’m aware that you can add your own custom written CSS, HTML, and JavaScript. But is the functionality that Melanie mentioned available to edit easily just using a HubSpot menu of some kind? Or is she going to need someone to write code to do this.

For what it’s worth, Melanie, my preferences page which I’ve only made minimal style changes to, functions exactly how you describe wanting it to. So my assumption is that everyone else should be working like that by default too. And so maybe yours was modified in a way to break that functionality, or there’s an option somewhere that someone checked or unchecked.

Unsure!
Thank you both <@U048C858Y94> and <@URQV7LU79> - I fear that possibly the functionality was broken. Would it be easier to see a screenshot of the code?
That is true, if the preference page template have been edited then that is where the issue might be coming from.
Yes, how can that be proved?

By checking the template [Subscription page preference page] used here <https://app.HubSpot.com/settings/............./marketing/email/subscriptions> if it is default or another

replace ............. with your portal id
It is from a HubSpot template called session

That is where the functionality is broken, you need to contact the developers of that theme/template and highlight the issue. As a last resort you can either use the default HubSpot template or get a developer like me :blush: to assist you.
